intro: Campylanthus spathulatus, commonly known as the broad-leafed campylanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural landscapes.
